page.title: 13QUERNMORE WATER PROJECT
page.content: The Lancashire Conjunctive Use Scheme is a water supply project to provide water for the North West of Lancashire without building reservoirs.The water is taken out of the River Lune along pipes to a pumping station in Quernmore Park.From there it is pumped through underground pipes 1.8m diameter to the tunnel entrance at Rowton,a distance of 5 kilometres. It is in a very beautiful area so the tunnel goes right under the hillside for 6 kilometres and comes out at Abbeystead.From there the water flows into the River Wyre at Abbeystead and on to a water treatment plant.At its deepest the tunnel is 160m below ground level.The entrance to the tunnel is in our 12 square km block.
